main_definition: Matthew is a common name, which can also be an idiom or slang referring to various meanings including the first Gospel in the New Testament of Christianity, and a term for sleepiness.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The first book of the New Testament, written by Matthew the Evangelist.
meanings_and_examples.example: Matthew is one of the four Gospels in the Bible that narrates about Jesus Christ's life and teachings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used to describe a sleepy or lethargic person.
meanings_and_examples.example: After staying up late last night, I felt so matthew today; everything seemed slow and dull.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal name for an individual with the given name Matthew.
meanings_and_examples.example: Matthew was born on January 1st. He is a very kind person.
